page.title: 11Health services, Warbleton
page.content: A Horam general practioner holds a weekly afternoon clinic for those who cannot drive the 5 miles to Horam. Other surgeries are at Punnetts Town and Heathfield all of which have associated health visitors who call as required. Heathfield has the nearest chemist shops but some prefer to go to Herstmonceux with its small friendly pharmacy. A monthly chiropody clinic is held in the village hall for Â£3 a session. People have to travel 10-20 miles to visit hospitals in Heathfield Eastbourne or Tunbridge Wells. There is a Victorian psychiatric hospital at Hellingly. Community physio- and occupational therapy is provided for the elderly and homebound with transport provided by ambulance or car if required. Dental surgeries are found in Hailsham and Heathfield but many patients choose to go further.
